alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 12:58AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southern California, including the following counties, in southern California, Riverside and San Bernardino. In southwest California, Orange. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Snow levels will be around 4000 feet with heavy snow possible at and above that elevation. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, Ontario, Corona, Orange, Fullerton, Costa Mesa, Rialto, Mission Viejo, Chino, Tustin, Redlands and Yorba Linda.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
